alert.note: Alert for Kimble (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS San Angelo (Central Texas San Angelo)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued June 21 at 5:41PM CDT until June 21 at 7:45PM CDT by NWS San Angelo
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 745 PM CDT THIS EVENING FOR SOUTH CENTRAL KIMBLE COUNTY... At 540 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms only light showers were over the warned area. Between 2 and 3.25 inches of rain have fallen just east of Junction, and 6 to 12 miles south of Junction. Additional rainfall amounts up to 0.25 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Junction, Segovia, South Llano River State Park, Telegraph, Us-83 Near The Kerr-Kimble County Line, The Intersection Of I-10 And Us 290, I-10 Near The Kimble-Kerr County Line and Us-377 Near The Kimble-Edwards County Line. This includes the following highways... Interstate 10 between Mile Markers 457 and 477. This includes the following Low Water Crossings... Park Road 73 crossing South Llano River, FM 2169 crossing Johnson Fork Creek, FM 2169 crossing Johnson Fork Creek, FM 2169 crossing Johnson Fork Creek, County Road 430 crossing Johnson Fork, County Road 430 crossing Joy Creek, KC 451 crossing Johnson Fork, Old Segovia Rd. crossing Johnson Fork, crossings along County Road 410 and Flatrock Ln. crossing South Llano River. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
